User FunctionsÂ¶

group ufunc

Functions to be defined by the user, specifically the definition of the right-hand side function RHS of the ODE

which is solved.

Functions

codi::RealReverse trunc(codi::RealReverse x)
void RHS(std::vector<codi::RealReverse> &res, std::vector<codi::RealReverse> &y, const reference_quantities_t &ref, model_constants_t &cc, nc_parameters_t &nc)

This function evaluates the RHS function of the ODE. It uses the 1 moment cloud scheme.

Parameters

  • res: On out: system state difference

  • y: Old system state

  • ref: Reference quantities to transform between units

  • cc: Pointer to constants from the model

  • nc: Pointer to parameters from the netCDF file

void Press_Temp(std::vector<codi::RealReverse> &res, std::vector<codi::RealReverse> &y, const reference_quantities_t &ref, model_constants_t &cc)

This function evaluates the RHS function of the ODE. It uses the 1 moment cloud scheme. Updates only pressure and temperature.

Parameters

  • res: On out: system state difference

  • y: Old system state

  • ref: Pointer to reference quantities to transform between units

  • cc: Pointer to constants from the model

template<class float_t>
void saturation_adjust(const float_t &T_prime, const float_t &p_prime, const float_t &p_sat, const float_t &qv_prime, const float_t &qc_prime, std::vector<float_t> &res, model_constants_t &cc)

Saturation adjustment that also adjusts temperature (no explicit calculation of latent heating/cooling; temperature change is given directly!).

T_prime Current temperature [K] p_prime Current pressure [Pa] p_sat Pressure at saturation [Pa] qv_prime Current water vapor mixing ratio qc_prime Current cloud water mixing ratio res Vector to store the changes at qv_idx, qc_idx and T_idx

template<class float_t>
void ccn_act_hande(float_t &p_prime, float_t &w_prime, float_t &T_prime, float_t &qv_prime, float_t &qc_prime, float_t &Nc, const double &EPSILON, std::vector<float_t> &res, model_constants_t &cc)

CCN activation after Hande et al 2016. https://doi.org/10.5194/acp-16-12059-2016

p_prime Pressure [Pa] w_prime Ascend velocity [m s^-1] T_prime Temperature [K] qv_prime Water vapor mixing ratio qc_prime Cloud water mixing ratio Nc Number of cloud droplets EPSILON Small value that qc needs to exceed res Vector to store the changes cc Model constants

template<class float_t>
void ccn_act_seifert(float_t &p_prime, float_t &p, float_t &T_prime, float_t &T, float_t &qv_prime, float_t &qv, float_t &qc_prime, float_t &qc, float_t &Nc, float_t &qr, float_t &z_prime, const double &dt, float_t &w, float_t &S, float_t &psat_prime, const reference_quantities_t &ref, std::vector<float_t> &res, model_constants_t &cc)

CCN activation after Seifert & Beheng (2006): p_prime Pressure [Pa] p Pressure but dimensionless T_prime Temperature [K] T Temperature but dimensionless qv_prime Water vapor mixing ratio qv Water vapor mixing ratio but dimensionless qc_prime Cloud water mixing ratio qc Cloud water mixing ratio but dimensionless Nc Number of cloud droplets qr Rain droplet mixing ratio but dimensionless z Height above sealevel [m] dt Timestep size [s] w Ascend velocity [m s^-1] S Saturation psat_prime Saturation pressure [Pa] ref Struct with reference values res Vector to store the changes cc Model constants

template<class float_t>
void ice_nuc_hom(float_t &T_prime, float_t &w_prime, float_t &p_prime, float_t &qv_prime, float_t &qi_prime, float_t &Ni, float_t &S_i, float_t &p_sat_ice, std::vector<float_t> &res, model_constants_t &cc)

Homogeneous freezing of cloud droplets. Cotton and Field (2002) Ice nucleation characteristics of an isolated wave cloud Freeze only if cloud droplets to freeze are available and the temperature is low enough.

template<class float_t>
void sedimentation_explicit(float_t &T_prime, float_t &S, float_t &qc_prime, float_t &qr_prime, float_t &Nr, float_t &qs_prime, float_t &Ns, float_t &qi_prime, float_t &Ni, float_t &qh_prime, float_t &Nh, float_t &qg_prime, float_t &Ng, float_t &p_prime, std::vector<float_t> &res, model_constants_t &cc)

Sedimentation after Seifert and Beheng (2006, 2008). This function processes rain, snow, ice, hail and graupel sedimentation at once.

T_prime Temperature [K] S Saturation qc_prime Cloud water mixing ratio qr_prime Rain mixing ratio Nr Number of rain droplets qs_prime Snowflakes mixing ratio Ns Number of snowflakes qi_prime Ice crystal mixing ratio Ni Number of ice crystals qh_prime Hail mixing ratio Nh Number of hail particles qg_prime Graupel mixing ratio Ng Number of graupel particles p_prime Pressure [Pa] res Vector to store the changes cc Model constants

template<class float_t>

Evaporation from melting ice particles.

qv_prime Water vapor mixing ratio e_d Partial pressure of water vapor p_sat Saturation pressure of water [Pa] s_sw Super saturation of water T_prime Temperature [K] q1 Mixing ratio of any ice particle N1 Particle number of any ice particle resq On out: difference of the ice particle mixing ratio pc1 Model constants specific for the given ice particle res Vector to store the changes dt_prime Time step size [s]

template<class float_t>
void vapor_dep_relaxation(float_t &qv_prime, float_t &qi_prime, float_t &Ni, float_t &qs_prime, float_t &Ns, float_t &qg_prime, float_t &Ng, float_t &qh_prime, float_t &Nh, float_t &s_si, float_t &p_sat_ice, float_t &e_d, float_t &p_prime, float_t &T_prime, const double &EPSILON, float_t &dep_rate_ice, float_t &dep_rate_snow, float_t &D_vtp, std::vector<float_t> &res, model_constants_t &cc)

Depositional growth of all ice particles. Deposition and sublimation, where deposition rate of ice and snow are being stored. Seifert (2008) Section 3.3

qv_prime Water vapor mixing ratio qi_prime Ice crystal mixing ratio Ni Number of ice crystals qs_prime Snowflakes mixing ratio Ns Number of snowflakes qg_prime Graupel mixing ratio Ng Number of graupel particles qh_prime Hail mixing ratio Nh Number of hail particles s_si Over saturation of ice p_sat_ice Saturation pressure of ice [Pa] T_prime Temperature [K] EPSILON Small value that the evaporation mass needs to exceed dep_rate_ice On out: deposition rate of ice mass dep_rate_snow On out: deposition rate of snow mass D_vtp Diffusivity of dry air [m^2 s^-1] res Vector to store the changes cc Model constants

template<class float_t>
std::vector<float_t> particle_collection(float_t &q1, float_t &q2, float_t &N1, float_t &N2, float_t &T_c, float_t &resN1, float_t &resQ1, collection_model_constants_t &coeffs, particle_model_constants_t &pc1, particle_model_constants_t &pc2, const double &dt_prime)

Particle collection for ice particles such as: graupel+ice -> graupel graupel+snow -> graupel hail+ice -> hail hail+snow -> hail snow+ice -> snow This function does only one of these.

q1 Mixing mass ratio q2 Mixing mass ratio N1 Number of particles N2 Number of particles T_c Difference between temperature and freezing temperature [K] coeffs Model constants for collision processes pc1 Model constants for a particle pc2 Model constants for a particle dt_prime Time step size [s]

Return

Vector of two float_t with the change in particle number (0) and change in mass mixing ratio (1)

template<class float_t>
void particle_particle_collection(float_t &qi_prime, float_t &Ni, float_t &qs_prime, float_t &Ns, float_t &qg_prime, float_t &Ng, float_t &T_prime, float_t &T_c, std::vector<float_t> &res, model_constants_t &cc)

Ice particle collections for the following processes: snow+ice -> snow graupel+graupel -> graupel graupel+ice -> graupel graupel+snow -> graupel All those processes are done in this function. Technically, this could be used for hail instead of graupel as well.

qi_prime Ice crystal mixing ratio Ni Number of ice crystals qs_prime Snowflakes mixing ratio Ns Number of snowflakes qg_prime Graupel mixing ratio Ng Number of graupel particles T_prime Temperature [K] T_c Difference between temperature and freezing temperature [K] res Vector to store the changes cc Model constants

template<class float_t>
void graupel_hail_conv(float_t &qc_prime, float_t &qr_prime, float_t &qi_prime, float_t &qg_prime, float_t &Ng, float_t &qh_prime, float_t &Nh, float_t &p_prime, float_t &T_prime, float_t &T_c, std::vector<float_t> &res, model_constants_t &cc)

template<class float_t>
void riming_cloud_core(float_t &qc_prime, float_t &Nc, float_t &q1, float_t &N1, particle_model_constants_t &pc1, collection_model_constants_t &coeffs, float_t &rime_rate_qb, float_t &rime_rate_nb, model_constants_t &cc)

Rate of ice or snow collecting cloud droplets where values are hard coded for rain droplets according to COSMO comments.

qc_prime Cloud water mixing ratio Nc Number of cloud droplets q1 Mixing mass ratio N1 Number of particles pc1 Model constants specific for the given ice particle coeffs Model constants for collision processes rime_rate_qb On out: Riming rate for mixing mass rime_rate_nb On out: Riming rate for number of particles cc Model constants

template<class float_t>
void riming_rain_core(float_t &qr_prime, float_t &Nr, float_t &q1, float_t &N1, particle_model_constants_t &pc1, collection_model_constants_t &coeffs, float_t &rime_rate_qa, float_t &rime_rate_qb, float_t &rime_rate_nb, model_constants_t &cc)

Riming of rain droplets with ice or snow particles.

qr_prime Rain mixing ratio Nr Number of rain droplets q1 Mixing ratio of any ice particle N1 Particle number of any ice particle pc1 Model constants specific for the given ice particle coeffs Model constants for collision processes rime_rate_qa On out: Riming rate for mixing mass rime_rate_qb On out: Riming rate for rain mixing mass rime_rate_nb On out: Riming rate for number of rain droplets

void ice_riming(float_t &qc_prime, float_t &Nc, float_t &qr_prime, float_t &Nr, float_t &qi_prime, float_t &Ni, float_t &dep_rate_ice, float_t &rime_rate_qc, float_t &rime_rate_nc, float_t &rime_rate_qr, float_t &rime_rate_nr, float_t &rime_rate_qi, float_t &T_prime, const double &dt, std::vector<float_t> &res, model_constants_t &cc)

template<class float_t>
void ice_melting(float_t &qi_prime, float_t &Ni, float_t &T_prime, const double &dt, std::vector<float_t> &res, model_constants_t &cc)

Ice melts instantanuous to rain or cloud droplets.

qi_prime Ice crystal mixing ratio Ni Number of ice crystals T_prime Current temperature [K] dt Timestep size [s] res Vector to store the changes cc Model constants

void RHS_SB(std::vector<codi::RealReverse> &res, std::vector<codi::RealReverse> &y, const reference_quantities_t &ref, model_constants_t &cc, nc_parameters_t &nc, const double &dt, bool fixed = false)

This function evaluates the RHS function of the ODE. It uses the 2 moment cloud scheme after Seifert and Beheng (2006), see https://doi.org/10.1007/s00703-005-0112-4 Based on mo_art_2mom_driver.f90 and mo_art_2mom_main.f90 of ICON.

Parameters

  • res: On out: system state difference

  • y: Old system state

  • ref: Pointer to reference quantities to transform between units

  • cc: Pointer to constants from the model

  • nc: Pointer to parameters from the netCDF file

  • dt: Timestep size

  • fixed: If True: Reset change of pressure, temperature and ascent (w) at the end to zero

void RHS_SB_no_ice(std::vector<codi::RealReverse> &res, std::vector<codi::RealReverse> &y, const reference_quantities_t &ref, model_constants_t &cc, nc_parameters_t &nc, bool fixed = false)

This function evaluates the RHS function of the ODE. It uses the 1 moment cloud scheme without ice after Seifert and Beheng (2006), see https://doi.org/10.1007/s00703-005-0112-4 and 10.1175/2008JAS2586.1

Parameters

  • res: On out: system state difference

  • y: Old system state

  • ref: Pointer to reference quantities to transform between units

  • cc: Pointer to constants from the model

  • nc: Pointer to parameters from the netCDF file

  • fixed: If True: Reset change of pressure, temperature and ascent (w) at the end to zero
